sources.data_found: Pete supercomputer: 10 GPU nodes, each containing at least two NVIDIA Quadro RTX6000 GPUs with a total of 22 GPUs
Pete's computational infrastructure comprises 22 graphics processing units
Department of Computer Science homepage - Bachelor of Science degree program in Computer Science is accredited by ABET
Engineering: 714 degrees awarded; Computer, Engineering, and Science: 526 employees (as of 2023)
Graduate Students page for Computer Science department

student_data.notes: CS enrollment numbers estimated based on DataUSA showing 714 Engineering degrees awarded in 2023 and 526 Computer, Engineering, and Science employees. Assuming CS represents approximately 20-25% of engineering degrees and maintaining typical 4:1 undergraduate to graduate ratio. PhD estimated at 1/3 of graduate students based on typical CS department distributions.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Pete supercomputer has 10 GPU nodes with at least 2 RTX6000 GPUs each, total of 22 GPUs

gpu_resources.notes: Current system is Pete supercomputer with 22 NVIDIA Quadro RTX6000 GPUs. New supercomputer being built with NSF MRI grant ($4M from NSF + $1.7M from OSU) will include next-generation NVIDIA GPUs, but specifications not yet finalized as of 2022 announcement.

analysis_notes: Oklahoma State University currently operates Pete supercomputer with 22 RTX6000 GPUs. Major new supercomputer funded in 2022 ($5.7M total) but specifications and deployment timeline not yet publicly available. Student counts estimated from available data.
